Comments: If you are any sort of baseball fan, you will love this in depth documentary. Being a Houston native I already thought Nolan Ryan was amazing, but this just opened my eyes so much more. I couldn't recommend this more. I'm so glad I had the chance to see it!

This was the best documentary I have ever seen!
I already was a huge Nolan Ryan as a baseball player fan but I am a bigger fan of him as a regular human and family man now.  This was an incredibly made documentary with so many baseball legends.  I can't wait until it comes out on DVD.
Very well done!  Great clips from the past!
It was a well made documentary on the outstanding career of Nolan Ryan! You dont have to be a baseball fan to enjoy this film.
If you are a baseball fan, this is a great story about one of the greatest pitchers off all time.  It covers his flaws, his dominance, and his family.  It's great story.
Excellent movie of family values, friends and baseball life.

Comments: This was an amazing movie.  I highly recommend. Make sure you stay post-credits because there is a teaser scene you do not want to miss.  Great story line and connects well with other Marvel movies and shows.  Highly recommend!
Visually epic. Decent story. B+ on the Marvel scale of story-telling.
Another great Marvel movie, liked the interaction with the characters of the Marvel universe :)

The movie delivered as promised.  It risked being overlong, but key aspects of the Marvel universe were finally displayed and in grand style.  There is promise for an ongoing storyline.  Cumberbatch remains perfectly cast.  A wee bit tired of the Phoenix/Wanda over-powered sags.  Looking forward to seeing demons thwarted!
The experience was very exciting with the moving sits

This film was INCREDIBLE!!! My wife and I are fans of the MCU. We LOVED the first one and didn't think the second one would be better. How wrong we were. It had lots of action and plenty of horror. We loved the horror aspect of the movie. Sam Raimi did an unbelievable job. We are also fans of Raimi's. If you haven't seen it yet, take our advice and see it in the theater. You won't be disappointed. Also, the ending will put you on the edge of your seat. We just seen this and can't wait for the next one. Congrats to Sam Raimi, Marvel, and Kevin Feige on a great piece of work!. Trust us when we say you will be really disappointed if you don't see it in the theater.
love the plot multiple universe's  surprised by horror the images and themes.
10/10 everything you can possibly hope it would be!

So good I saw it twice, once in IMAX 3D and once in Digital 3D.  My favorite Marvel movie yet.  You may want to watch Dr, Strange and Wanda Vision beforehand if you've never seen them or rewatch them if it's been a while since you saw them to refresh your memory.  It's a great mix of action, horror, and comedy with stunning visuals.

After paying a premium price to watch Dr Strange at the Jersey Gardens AMC Dolby Theater, I was disappointed by how badly the sound system was maintained. The front speaker volume was so loud as be distorted and out of balance with the acoustics of the theater. My ears are still ringing!  This was not realistic sound. It was badly set up sound. Voices were strained and unnatural.  Too bad, maybe AMC should send one of their techs to my place to experience how good a well-balanced Dolby Atmos set up can sound. Worse, the sound cut out entirely for five minutes during a key segment of the movie. Probably from having blown a circuit breaker!  Disappointed.

Title: Sonic the Hedgehog 2

Comments: Alex Garland is the most tedious filmmaker in a24's roster after maybe Ari Aster. A smug, empty, navel-gazing exercise in allyship that we used to buy wholesale from dudes like Alex Garland before we learned better (e.g. if a dude is this desperate to let you know that he's "one of the good ones" -- get as far away as you can). Bad pacing and choppy editing only serve to expose how empty-headed and one-note the script is. His only critique is "men bad" which, like, yeah and? There's no elaboration or insight, just tepid satire of the lowest order. On top of all that, Garland doesn't seem to know if he's making a body horror movie, a folk horror movie or a cosmic horror movie and as a result the thing just gets all mangled up. It's got that standard A24 sheen (which: yuck), but don't let that fool you: this movie is a mess and you'll spend 100 minutes wishing you were doing just about anything else.

Some of the visuals need a little touch up and when they came up took me out of the story for a moment but overall it was really good. Creepy, unexpected, and reminded me of some of my weirdest nightmares. I wish more time was spent on explaining our characters motivations but I see the creators reasoning for not

Definitely a unique film. Expected to be really shocked and confused due to the other reviews. For the horror genre it was actually quite normal. Cinematography was solid. Really enjoyed what it tried to do. The ending could’ve driven the point home more or given the audience more but it’s also great because it’s open to interpretation. Worth a watch
Very confusing but good
The story made no sense whatsoever!
I was not clear on the ending , I thought that everything was just in her imagination.
Did not care for this at all.  Disappointed.   It wasn't as scary as it was more psychologically weird than anything.

Definitely not a film that's for everybody. The film is heavily metaphorical and if you can bear with on that then you may be able to enjoy or at the very least get through. for me this movie might require a few watches before I can say or even interpret what it means. it's not exactly clear but it is a horror-ish nightmare of a scenario and I was able to enjoy it on that.

Comments: An amazing film, not what I expected. It seemed to be a science fiction ,psychological introspection ,time travel, love story, mother/daughter ,kung fu psychedelic trip with sex toys! A masterpiece of film editing. It left an impression for sure .Kind of a WTF feeling.........
maybe the perfect movie

Title: Uncharted

Comments: I thought it was a great ‘feel good’  movie plus a true story. I highly recommend it.
Fabulous true story that leaves you with all the right ways to express and treat your family and life with understanding, love and support.  A terrific way to respond without judging.
A great inspirational message lost in a slow movie. But being a true story it had to be told.

I can see why many of the critics panned this movie as they tend to do with so many films with themes that involve God,......unless, of course, it's an anti-God film.  
Having said that, the film's message about a man discovering the value and merit of trials and suffering in his life makes this movie a 5-star.  Wahlberg gave his typical good performance while Mel Gibson, in a supporting role, was a standout.  

Whether one philosophically or religiously agrees with the main character at the end of the film or not(btw--I'm not Catholic), the film asks each viewer to make the same analysis of the meaning of suffering, trials and when bad things happen in our own lives, whether our decisions were partly to blame (or, as several of the characters were by their own choices, wholly  to blame) or whether we are victims of circumstance be it parents, auto accidents, etc.  

Though it's not a heart-pounding, thrill ride, Father Stu is a meaningful and inspiring 2-hour watch.

The most dark and gritty depiction of Gotham city by far. You can feel the city is in desperate need of a hero. I have never seen a Batman that has been so brooding and brutal on-screen before. The film is like a neo-noir superhero film and the story just sucks you in with its detective style. The entire cast did a great job with a great job with bringing these characters to life. As well as, Matt Reeve's giving the audience some great shots of the city and some cool action sequences. I really can't wait for the next chapter in this new Batman trilogy!

Title: The Batman

Loved this movie from start to finish. It is no Hollywood bang bang type of movie but what a great story of love, brotherhood and friendship as well as redemption. I thought this movie was amazing. Loved the noir feel of it peppered with fantastic subtle comedy and even surprise appearances by Tiffany Haddish and Henry Winkler. The only flaw was it was too short. I couldve watched this story unfold all day long. Great performances by the two leading characters. Appreciated the references to race relations and acceptance. This movie goes to show you - you never know what is going on with your neighbor, the person in line at the store next to you or even your own family members. Treat people with kindness as you do not know their circumstances. Great directing debut for Jerrod Carmichael!

Metadata.Producer: Scott McGehee, Jennifer Roth, David Siegel

Title: Montana Story

Comments: This French movie is about abortion when this procedure was illegal in the 1960s France, and the law was strictly enforced and everyone was afraid to break it, no doctor would risk jail if a woman ventured to request an abortion. So, when this young woman became accidentally pregnant, she was devastated because it meant to throw away her ambition to pursue a professional career and her future. When she sought an abortion, no one would dare to help her, no friends or her physicians wanted to hear about it. The young woman makes risky attempts to end her pregnancy and her life became a nightmare. This movie arrives in the United States when American women are on the verge of losing their right to choose an abortion thanks to an impending decision by judges in the Supreme Court bent on ending this right that has existed for almost fifty years.
Unflinching and intense. Well acted.
Excellent story, excellent acting.  This is a difficult story that needs to be told and heard by the masses.
A graphic, courageous, heart-wrenching French film about a young woman who seeks an abortion when it was still illegal.
Very topical movie.  The abortion was horrible and in your face. I hope we focus more on providing support for women, no matter what their choice.
The best movie I've seen all year. Also the most important movie you'll see this year.
As unflinchingly raw, real & relevant a film the world has ever needed right now. Cinematically magnificent  in every facet. It must not be missed. It cannot be forgotten.

Comments: The movie gives you a look in the family dynamics of an Iranian family, but there are so many questions which are not answered that the viewer now wants to hit the road again to better understand. The youngest child is the star of the show!
Some random scenes and dialogues that confused me, but overall great movie and glad to see Panahi following his father's footsteps and also keeping his legacy alive.

Metadata.Producer: Mastaneh Mohajer, Jafar Panahi, Panah Panahi

Title: Hit the Road

Comments: The best headache Ive ever experienced.

Metadata.Producer: Olivier Muller, Clément Lepoutre, Gary Farkas, Anthony Vaccarello, Gaspar Noé

Title: Lux Æterna

Comments: I found the testimonies of the individuals to be believable and the scholarly evaluations by doctors and professors to be convincing.  I am almost 80 and have had a long road beyond my original skepticism and this film enforced my belief.
Touching look at amazing stories in peoples lives

Appreciated all the research to present this documentary.  Loved Sarah's book.  Glad to see movies like this to present ideas not thought about before.  Enlightening, Inspiring and thought provoking.  Well worth the time.

LOVED REMEMBERING HEAVEN!!! Saw it Saturday night and was impressed - but the volume was ear-splitting. Had to sit there with my fingers in my ears to be able to muffle the volume. Only 5 of us in the audience. 
Saw the movie again this morning with two family members. Upon entering, I asked the young man at the ticket scanner if the volume could please be turned down. Apparently he did have it turned down because it was much more bearable - yet was still quite loud. Important that we do NOT lose any of our hearing because of being subjected to ear-splitting volume! THANK YOU!!! Have just spread the word to my friends - and hope to rearrange my schedule to see it one more time.

Metadata.Producer: William Mellyn, Jackie Mellyn, Laura Hinze Lofgreen

Title: Remembering Heaven

Metadata.Producer: Martin Shore, Cody Dickinson, Dan Sameha, Eric Krasno, Eric Heigle, Ian Neville

Title: Take Me to the River: New Orleans

Metadata.Producer: Tia Wou, Fab 5 Freddy, Amir Soltani, Stefan Forbes
not available

Comments: Tender and romantic story of 2 Estonian soldiers

Good story, cheesy and superficial dialogs and dramaturgy, not such good directing, not the greatest acting (but not entirely terrible all the time), nice cinematography... and iiiinsanely handsome two leading actors!
Very captivating true life story of love, bravery, and loss
This story shows the strength of love, even in the adversity of a repressive military environment.

Great acting
Wonderful storyline
The filming is excellent!
This movie was a struggle of love between two military men during difficult times! It was extremely well acted and the story-line was enlightening!
LOVED the story and the fact that its based on a true story makes it ALL the more enjoyable!
Great story. Emotionless performances.
Great acting. Good story line.
Beautifully bittersweet unfortunately, relevant still

Metadata.Producer: Tom Prior, Peeter Rebane, Brigita Rozenbrika

Title: Firebird

Comments: I had no idea that it was a foreign film with subtitles.  After a few minutes I got used to reading the dialog. The Horror genre of the fim sneaks up onyou, well done.

Metadata.Producer: Maria Ekerhovd, Misha Jaari, Mark Lwoff

Title: The Innocents

Metadata.Producer: Nuri Bilge Ceylan

Comments: a short and sweet story that was beautiful to watch. you'll know the whole film from the first 5 minutes and there are no surprises along the way. all the notes are purely struck, the acting is right on, and the tag line, 'what is life without beauty' is in every frame.
Delightful film which is a joy to watch.
A beautiful story. Well acted and wonderful subject matter.
A rose by another name, would never be the same. A wonderful journey played beautifully by a talented cast with a perfect soundtrack.
Beautifully told film with a carefully chosen cast of actors.

Metadata.Producer: Stéphanie Carreras, Philippe Pujo

Title: The Rose Maker

Comments: Enjoyed the nostalgia.
Charming and interesting!
The screening was canceled and Fandango never emailed me so I didn’t find out until I got to the theater.
Wonderful look back on the life and times of a New York and Philadelphia institution.

Metadata.Producer: Lisa Hurwitz, Alec Shuldiner, Russell Greene

Title: The Automat

Metadata.Producer: Alan McAlex, Ajay Rai
Matteo Rovere

Comments: I thought the film subtly unveiled the inner thoughts of the characters over the course of its run.  Certainly not an action film but a fine job on character study
It dragged a little, but I did like the flash forwards and flash backwards story telling.
I liked the moody tone of this film and the exceptional acting. The pace is probably slow for some viewers, but I found it introspective and nuanced.
Too slow moving and really didn't understand who was what and what was who.  Could only understand about half of dialogue spoken and continuous flashbacks contributed to confusion.
Intimate details of the lives of people with limited choices. The heroine opens access to freedom both for herself and the people she encounters.
Great character driven film.

Probably a good movie if you like S L O W,
S L O W,  S L O W literary type movies.  Also, 20 or 30 minutes of bare-naked nudity.  I couldn't say why she's walking around  nude, but who am I to complain.

What a waste of time!! Absolutely boring! Producers tried to keep your attention by having a young girl walk around nude for half the movie! Disjointed, poor character development, and no real plot! We love Colin Firth and have NO idea why he would associate with this movie!! Such a disappointment! Every character in this movie is creepy!
Long, Boring and Disappointing.
Wonderful film, great characters, musical score was luscious, and great story! Loved it!

Metadata.Producer: Elizabeth Karlsen, Stephen Woolley

Title: Mothering Sunday

Metadata.Producer: David Thion, Stéphane Demoustier, Philippe Martin, Igor Auzépy

Comments:
SM was a sweet quirky film reminiscent of Beetlejuice & Big Fish! Dreamy, strange & delightful.

Cozy date film
A magical mystery tour that is totally mind-blowing. I loved it.

Very quirky weirdness. Hard to intellectualize snd summsrize briefly. You just need to experience it. Very imaginative imagery and observations about the human mind. Might not be profound, but it is amusing.

Metadata.Director: Kentucker Audley, Albert Birney, Albert Birney
Metadata.Producer: Emma Hannaway, Matisse Rifai, Taylor Shung, Sarah Winshall

Title: Strawberry Mansion

Comments: Very original and beautifully stylized.  Really enjoyed Hatching.
I get the concept but the movie left us with no answer

What a bizarre and awesome movie 🎬 
I highly recommend seeing this movie. Yes it is subtitled in English, not hard to follow at all. They did an amazing job making this film.
Watch for the insanity, stay for the gnarly.
Themes and undertones were understandable. Atmospheric, eerie and scary. The music score elevated the scenes they were in. A good modern creature story.

Was interesting but couldve been much more. They couldve pushed it more but for what they did it was interesting. Liked that it didnt have cheap scares or fake pullback where its a dream haha. More psychological than horror.

no scares. just gross and creepy and unless you buy into the weird premise, barely works at all. One "monster" looks like a bad puppet. Other than a few characters, the acting is pretty mediocre and and if the characters had half a brain they'd see what's going on. No one seems to have a clue until it's too late. All that and you get to read subtitles for 90 minutes. Pass.
Weird and semi-infuriating at parts. Characters act with an unbelievable ignorance and lack of situational awareness. Super weird. Close to “so bad it’s good” status but not quite there.

This is the most amazing, original horror film I have ever seen.  It is not boring even though it is Finnish.  The monster in it is terrifying.  How it changes the girl who hatches it is very frightening.  The mother is just as terrifying.  It is an interesting study how parents project their own failed ambitions onto their children.   First rate acting especially from the girl, mother and adulterous lover.  This director is going to be around.
Wild movie. Mix of ET/Shape of Water/Carrie. Tense at times, with some jump scares.

Metadata.Producer: Mika Ritalahti, Nico Ritalahti, Nima Yousefi

Title: Hatching

Comments: Very shallow, definitely don’t recommend it.
Imaginative development of characters, very French.

Metadata.Producer: Valérie Schermann, Jacques Audiard

Title: Paris, 13th District

Comments: I read the book and loved the movie. I appreciated how it showed a new perspective on the struggles of dating and finding the perfect mate for everyone. Understanding how people face different challenges in their lives. It's a sweet and serious love story.
Holy Hell this is a bad movie.  This wouldn't make the cut for a Hallmark movie.
Eye opening and heart felt
Amazing story. So good. Great acting and true love.  Went with family member in their early 20s who also thought it was Amazing.

I liked the chemistry between the two leads.  It a lot of heart.  A bit farfetched in the storyline with the grandma accepting the grand daughter in law with her past. Also her seeming to like the doorman.  All in all I thought it was a enjoyable film to pass the time.
Must see!!! Engaging, heartwarming, and one of the best movies Ive seen in a long, long time. You will not be disappointed.

A beautiful love story about the difficulty of a person with autism to find acceptance and love. The horror of human trafficking is shown. The acting of the two leads is exceptional, and the soundtrack is beautiful. Bring your handkerchief.

The strength of this film is the story. An unlikely pair of of people, mismatched and misunderstood. But despite the barriers they have to deal with, they learn how to love each other. The film is sweet, funny, and heartbreaking. Check it out!
Loved the comedy, acting and music.  Appreciated the diverse characters.

This movie proved a great and powerful movie can be made without using foul language. 
The cast was excellent in their roles and they showed how awful sex trafficking is

Metadata.Producer: Allen Wolf

Title: The Sound of Violet

Comments: Eye opening documentary. Unfortunately those who NEED to see this, won't.
Dinesh does the research and always makes such great and truthful documentaries.
Facts not conspiracy theory.   Just do not understand why these people aren't prosecuted and the Republicans are silent.
Well documented and persuasive arguments.  The entire presentation came with a sense of honesty and fair play.
If your gut said something was not right with the 2020 presidential election, you have to see this movie. If you think that I'm a tin foil hat nut case you should go see it, you will be shocked!
Amazing movie, regardless of how you voted this is a must see film.
Information was concise and factual. Very happy to see people actually pursue the truth!
Loved the concrete evidence presented!

It presented information that I had never seen or heard of before in a very scientific and irrefutable way that cannot be challenged. It simply greatly reinforced in my mind that the election was stolen
I was impressed with the data that was gathered and presented.  It's worth seeing to decide for yourself.

Metadata.Director: Dinesh D'Souza, Debbie D'Souza, Bruce Schooley
Metadata.Producer: Dinesh D'Souza, Catherine Engelbrecht, Gregg Phillips

Title: 2000 Mules

Comments: this movie had me on the edge of my seat and in my feels the whole time. they made it perfectly
this movie had it all. comedy, drama, heartbreak, intensity, i 100% recommend you see this. powerful stuff.
Such a fun movie with a powerful message.

Metadata.Producer: Marty Bowen, John Fischer, Isaac Klausner

Title: Emergency

Comments: This movie was so funny. Mgk and Mod sun did a great job with this movie. Love how it featured lots of songs and not just from the Mainstream Sellout album. Highly recommend seeing this especially if you love Machine Gun Kelly

Metadata.Producer: Chris Long, Jib Polhemus

Title: Good Mourning

Metadata.Producer: Athina Rachel Tsangari, Maria Hatzakou, Chrysanthi Karfi Koi

Comments:
Family loved it including 15 and 13 year old.  Not quite like being there but creative and my kids want to go into set design!!!

The music was a BEST OF so no problems there and the director and performances were top notch.  I wish I could buy it on Apple iTunes as I can always use me some more replays of talent.
THIS MOVIE WAS SO AMAZINGGGGGGG
It was like watching a mini concert. So talented and energetic. Love their music.
Nice to experience a concert without having to actually go to a concert. Very well done and a great experience.
It was very entertaining! Loved it!!
This was a great experience. I watched the live stream when they first announced absolutely loved it and when they said it would be in theaters I had to go.
Absolutely loved it!!!!!!!
Such a great idea to show this on a large theatre screen with brilliant sound.
A beautiful theatrical recut of the original livestream, including behind the scenes footage and early band footage.  It's a new but familiar animal, and I'm so glad I had a chance to see it.
Favorite band ever!!

Metadata.Producer: not available

Title: Twenty One Pilots Cinema Experience

Metadata.Producer: Kevin Proctor

Comments:
Really well done documentary on a subject most are very passionate about.
I am impressed.
Excellent documentary that teaches the truth about life in the womb. The personal witnesses and graphic analogies we're powerful.
Very logical and straightforward analysis
This was very informative and thought provoking.

It was informative and very well done. They showed compassion and love in telling why life matters. Hope many saw it and realize that life matters. That the life in the womb matters as much the woman carrying the baby. Both lives matter.
Excellent. Well Done. Real life stories.
I liked all the facts and statistics. It was good to hear truth even if it is hard to hear.
An absolute must-see for everyone in our country! Very factual and thorough in it's approach.
Excellent documentary with much important information about the current state of the abortion debate.
It was a very excellently done informative movie!!!  Hope it would be allowed to stay in theater longer! Recommend HIGHLY!

Comments: Liked the action especially Kangana Ranaut, a lovely and kick ass agent.
